title: Unblemished red heifer with two hairs
vignette: Inspectors find two black hairs on a nearly perfect red heifer.

options.text: Disqualify it from use for ash preparation.
Two hairs are insignificant; still valid.

title: Heifer owned jointly by partners
vignette: Two families purchase a red heifer together.

options.text: It must belong entirely to the community treasury.
Joint ownership is acceptable if both consent.

title: Animal worked briefly by mistake
vignette: The heifer was led with a yoke for a few minutes before anyone noticed.

options.text: Any work disqualifies it completely.
Such minor use can be overlooked.

title: Slaughter outside the central complex Mount
vignette: The red heifer is slaughtered on the Mount of Olives rather than inside the courtyard.

options.text: This is correct; it must be outside the central complex.
Better to slaughter inside for dignity.

title: Cedar wood missing from the ceremonial bundle
vignette: Preparers cannot find cedar branches for mixing with the ashes.

options.text: Proceed with hyssop and scarlet wool only.
Delay until all three components are ready.

title: Ashes stored in a metal container
vignette: Tradition prefers earthenware jars but only metal ones are available.

options.text: Metal containers are acceptable in a pinch.
Use earthenware only even if it causes delay.

title: Contact with a corpse during preparation
vignette: One of the assistants preparing the ashes touches a dead body.

options.text: The whole process must restart with new materials.
Only the contaminated assistant is replaced; continue using the ashes.

title: Mixing spring water from two sources
vignette: They combine water from two approved springs for the purification mixture.

options.text: Mixture is valid as long as both sources are clean.
Use a single spring to avoid doubts.

title: Sprinkling performed by a minor
vignette: A young boy sprinkles the purification water on a defiled person.

options.text: It is valid if supervised.
A minor may not perform the rite at all.

title: Ashes lost and replaced
vignette: Most of the original ashes were accidentally spilled and lost.

options.text: Prepare a new heifer to replenish the supply.
Use what remains and supplement with ordinary water.

title: Sprinkling performed on the wrong day
vignette: The contaminated person was sprinkled on day two instead of day three.

options.text: Repeat the sprinkling on the proper days.
Accept it; timing is less critical.

title: Using rainwater collected in a cistern
vignette: Instead of spring water, they have rain collected in a lined pit.

options.text: Rainwater works if the cistern is sealed and clean.
Only running spring water is valid.

title: senior professional mixes ashes barehanded
vignette: The officiating senior professional forgets gloves while combining the ashes and water.

options.text: It remains valid; gloves are merely precautionary.
Contact invalidates the mixture; discard and restart.

title: Ashes transported outside designated zone
vignette: Some ashes are taken abroad for distant communities.

options.text: Permitted to help those far away.
They must remain in designated zone only.

title: Heifer purchased with stolen funds
vignette: Later it turns out the community money used to buy the heifer was embezzled.

options.text: Heifer is invalid; acquire a new one with honest funds.
Use it anyway; the animal itself is fine.
